fr.liglab.adele.icasa.common
Interface StateVariable

All Known Subinterfaces:
ContextualStateVariable
public interface StateVariable

Represents a state with a defined type. A state variable explicitly defines if it is able to push notifications of state value changes.

Author:
Thomas Leveque

Method Detail

getName

String getName()
Returns variable name.

Returns:
variable name.

canSendNotifications

boolean canSendNotifications()
Returns true if it is able to push notifications of state value changes. This does not mean that it is able to push one notification for every value change but that a value change will be sent at least with a certain latency.

Returns:
true if it is able to push notifications of state value changes.

canBeModified

boolean canBeModified()
Returns true if its value can be modified using the setValue method. If false, this does not mean that the value cannot be changed outside current digital service.

Returns:
true if its value can be modified using the setValue method.

Add a listener which listens of value changes.

Parameters:
listener - a listener of value changes.

removeListener

void removeListener(StateVariableListener listener)
Removes specified listener.

Parameters:
listener - a listener of value changes.

getValue

Object getValue()
Returns variable value. Null means that there is no value defined.

variable value.
